title: 105_hr2688
content: The Act may be cited as the "Economic Development Information Act of 1997". It includes findings and declarations. Congress finds that accurate and timely information on economic development programs at the federal, state, and local levels is crucial for maintaining a strong national economy and addressing unemployment and underemployment in various regions. The collaboration of business leaders, academia, and the public is crucial for economic development. Previous efforts by the Economic Development Administration have successfully assisted communities affected by military or Department of Energy closures. Congress acknowledges the success of previous Economic Development Administration efforts in providing economic information to communities impacted by military or Department of Energy closures. In furtherance of maintaining the national economy, Congress declares the need to expand the provision of economic development information. Congress declares the need to expand economic development information to assist areas suffering from economic distress or deterioration, providing access to Governmentwide resources in a useful format. The need to expand economic development information to assist areas in economic distress or deterioration by providing access to Governmentwide resources in a useful format. The Public Works and Economic Development Act of 1965 is amended to include a new section establishing the Office of Economic Development Information. This office aims to provide access to Governmentwide resources in a useful format to assist areas in economic distress or deterioration. The Secretary will establish an Office of Economic Development Information within the Economic Development Administration. The Office will serve as a central information clearinghouse for economic development programs at the federal, state, and local levels, assisting applicants in locating and applying for assistance. The Office of Economic Development Information will assist applicants in finding and applying for economic development assistance at federal, state, and local levels, as well as develop electronic links to information databases for this purpose. The Office of Economic Development Information will develop electronic links to databases for identifying and applying for assistance under economic development programs at federal, state, and local levels. The Office of Economic Development Information will develop electronic links to databases containing relevant information on available economic development programs of the Federal Government, including key contacts, application process details, eligibility requirements, selection procedures, and follow-up processes. The Office of Economic Development Information will provide relevant information on Federal, State, and local economic development programs, including key contacts, application processes, eligibility requirements, and economic data and trends. The Office of Economic Development Information will provide relevant information on major State and local economic development programs, economic data and trends, case studies, and best practices in economic development. The Office of Economic Development Information provides information on national, regional, and local impacts of trade agreements, defense spending, technological change, economic development case studies, technology utilization programs, and resources. This includes compilations of published works related to economic development and information on revolving loan funds. Resources provided by the Office of Economic Development Information include technology utilization programs, compilations of published works related to economic development, information on revolving loan fund programs, and resources for identifying potential sources of capital for businesses. The Office of Economic Development Information provides resources for identifying potential sources of capital for businesses, understanding sustainable development, and accessing data services for the public. The Office of Economic Development Information provides resources for understanding and pursuing sustainable development initiatives. Public access to data services is ensured through an easily accessible information clearinghouse, including an Internet website with key locations sorted. The Office of Economic Development Information ensures public access to data services through an Internet website with key locations sorted by economic development topics, a toll-free nationwide telephone number, and online electronic access. The Office of Economic Development Information provides access to various resources for economic development topics, including a toll-free nationwide telephone number, online electronic access, printed manuals, orientation materials, periodic workshops, and on-call information specialists. The Office of Economic Development Information offers network services, computer database access, printed manuals, orientation materials, workshops, and on-call specialists for assistance. Coordination with other federal departments and agencies is required to achieve the objectives of this section. The Secretary must coordinate with other federal departments and agencies to achieve the objectives of this section, which includes economic development defined as economic adjustment, disaster recovery, industrial retention, and defense reinvestment. Authorization of appropriations is provided for necessary funding.
